references.paper_title: The functional specialization of visual cortex emerges from training parallel pathways with self-supervised predictive learning
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it introduces a novel deep learning model that successfully mimics the functional specialization of the visual cortex, a key area of focus in the main paper.

references.paper_title: A solution to the learning dilemma for recurrent networks of spiking neurons
references.reason: This work is crucial as it presents a novel approach to training recurrent spiking neural networks, directly addressing the limitations of existing methods that are also discussed in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Simulation of networks of spiking neurons: a review of tools and strategies
references.reason: As a comprehensive review of tools and strategies for simulating spiking neural networks, this paper is highly relevant to the methodology used in the main paper.

references.paper_title: SpikingJelly: An open-source machine learning infrastructure platform for spike-based intelligence
references.reason: The open-source software, SpikingJelly, is essential for the implementation and validation of the models in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Deep spiking neural networks with high representation similarity model visual pathways of macaque and mouse
references.reason: This paper is critical because it establishes a baseline for the performance of deep spiking neural networks in modeling visual pathways, providing context for evaluating the results in the main paper.
